title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)

Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature is consuming more code than intended. When adding a parameter to the 'baz' call in the 'bar' method, the program needs to be corrected.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the enclosed class.
2. Locate the 'bar' method.
3. Add a parameter to the 'baz' call in the 'bar' method.
4. Observe the code that is generated by the code assist feature.

Expected Behavior:
Instead of generating 'baz(x.foo().foo())', it is expected that the code assist feature generates 'baz(x.foo(), x.foo())'.

KUM (5/21/01 9:02:11 AM) - The text to replace is computed by the code assist infrastructure.
Moved to ITPJCORE.PM (9/4/2001 2:58:56 PM) - An option was added.
PM (9/25/2001 2:20:50 PM) - The option was removed.

The choice between replacing until the end or until the cursor location should be conditioned by a keystroke (enter=replace until end, insert=replace until cursor location). This issue should be moved to ITPJUI.
